    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • menu

        public void menu()
        Displays a menu to the user and allows them to interact with the system. The user can choose from several options to manage users and bibliographic products.

      • addUser

        public void addUser()
        Prompts the user to enter their name, ID, and user type. Adds a new user to the system with the provided information.

      • addBibliographicProduct

        public void addBibliographicProduct()
        Prompts the user to enter information about a new bibliographic product, including its name, number of pages, value, publication date, and URL. The user can choose to add either a book or a magazine.

      • validateProductToModify

        public void validateProductToModify()
        Prompts the user to enter the ID of the product they want to modify. Validates that a product with the given ID exists and, if so, calls the `requestFieldToModify()` method to allow the user to modify the product.

      • requestFieldToModify

        public void requestFieldToModify(java.lang.String productId,
                                 int productTypeFlag)
        Prompts the user to choose which field of the product they want to modify. Calls the `modifyProduct()` method to perform the modification.
        Parameters:
        productId - The ID of the product to modify.
        productTypeFlag - An integer indicating the type of product (book or magazine).

      • modifyProduct

        public void modifyProduct(java.lang.String productId,
                          int productTypeFlag,
                          int field,
                          int dataType)
        Prompts the user to enter the new value for the field they want to modify. Calls the `controller.modifyProduct()` method to perform the modification.
        Parameters:
        productId - The ID of the product to modify.
        productTypeFlag - An integer indicating the type of product (book or magazine).
        field - An integer indicating which field of the product to modify.
        dataType - An integer indicating the data type of the new value.

      • deleteProduct

        public void deleteProduct()
        Prompts the user to enter the ID of the product they want to delete. Calls the `controller.deleteProduct()` method to perform the deletion.

      • createObjects

        public void createObjects()
        Prompts the user to enter the number of objects to create. Calls the `controller.initObjects()` method to create the specified number of books and magazines.

      • addProductToUser

        public void addProductToUser()
        Adds a product to a user by requesting user and product IDs and calling the controller's `addProductToUser` method.

      • deleteProductToUser

        public void deleteProductToUser()
        Deletes a product from a user by requesting user and product IDs and calling the controller's `deleteProductToUser` method.

      • showUserLibrary

        public void showUserLibrary()
        This method displays the user's library and allows them to navigate through its pages. The user can choose to go to the previous or next page, exit the library view, start a reading session by typing the coordinates of a product or by typing its id.

      • startReadingSession

        public void startReadingSession(java.lang.String userId,
                                java.lang.String productId)
        Starts a reading session for a specified user and bibliographic product.
        Parameters:
        userId - the ID of the user starting the reading session
        productId - the ID of the bibliographic product to read

      • showMatrix

        public void showMatrix(java.lang.String[][] matrix)
        Displays a 2D array in a matrix format.
        Parameters:
        matrix - the 2D array to display

      • showReadPages

        public void showReadPages()
        This method displays the number of pages read in books and magazines.

      • showGenreAndCategoryWithTheGreaterNumberOfReadPages

        public void showGenreAndCategoryWithTheGreaterNumberOfReadPages()
        This method displays the genre and category with the greatest number of read pages.

      • showTop5Products

        public void showTop5Products()
        This method displays the top 5 products with the greatest number of read pages.

      • showBookSolds

        public void showBookSolds()
        This method displays the number of books sold by genre.

      • showMagazineSuscriptions

        public void showMagazineSuscriptions()
        This method displays the number of magazine subscriptions by category.

      • validateIntegerInput

        public int validateIntegerInput()
        Reads the input of the user. If the user typed a non integer value, returns -1. Otherwise, returns the input.
        Returns:
        The value that was registered by the user, or -1 if the user didn't type an integer.

      • validatePositiveInt

        public int validatePositiveInt()
        Put the user in a loop until he types a positive integer Puts the user in a loop until he types a positive integer
        Returns:
        An positive double

      • validateNonNegativeInt

        public int validateNonNegativeInt()
        This method validates that the user's input is a non-negative integer. If the input is not valid, the user is prompted to enter a new value until a valid value is entered.
        Returns:
        The validated non-negative integer value entered by the user.

      • validateDoubleInput

        public double validateDoubleInput()
        Reads the input of the user. If the user typed a non double value, returns -1.
        Returns:
        The value that was registered by the user, or -1 if the user didn't type a double.

      • validateNonNegativeDouble

        public double validateNonNegativeDouble()
        Puts the user in a loop until he types a non negative double
        Returns:
        A non negative double

      • requestDate

        public java.util.GregorianCalendar requestDate()
        Puts the user in a loop until he types a valid date.
        Returns:
        Return a valid GregorianCalendar date. A valid day is an integer from [1 to 31]. A valid month is an integer from [1 to 12]. A valid year is an integer greater than 0.

      • validateStringGivenAnArrayOfPossibleValidStrings

        public java.lang.String validateStringGivenAnArrayOfPossibleValidStrings(java.lang.String[] options)
        Prompts the user to enter a string and validates it against an array of possible valid options. Returns the validated string. This function puts the user in a loop until the input is valid.
        Parameters:
        options - an array of possible valid strings
        Returns:
        the validated string entered by the user

      • requestUserId

        public java.lang.String requestUserId()
        Prompts the user to enter their user ID and validates it using the controller's `validateUserId` method. Returns the validated user ID or an empty string
        Returns:
        the validated user ID entered by the user, or an empty string

      • requestProductId

        public java.lang.String requestProductId()
        Prompts the user to enter a product ID and validates it using the controller's `validateProductId` method. Returns the validated product ID or an empty string if validation fails.
        Returns:
        the validated product ID entered by the user or an empty string if validation fails

      • requestUserAndProductId

        public java.lang.String[] requestUserAndProductId()
        Requests and validates user and product IDs using the `requestUserId` and `requestProductId` methods. Returns an array containing the validated user and product IDs or empty strings if validation fails.
        Returns:
        an array containing the validated user and product IDs or empty strings if validation fails

      • validateCoordinates

        public int[] validateCoordinates()
        Prompts the user to enter X and Y coordinates and validates them to be within the range of 0 to 4 using the `validateNonNegativeInt` method. Returns an array containing the validated coordinates. This function puts the user in loop.
        Returns:
        an array containing the validated X and Y coordinates
